The writing <S%H4385><s%> of Hezekiah <S%H2396><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> of Judah <S%H3063><s%>, when he had been sick <S%H2470><s%>, and was recovered <S%H2421><s%> of his sickness <S%H2483><s%>.

My dwelling <S%H1755><s%> is removed <S%H5265><s%>, and is carried <S%H1540><s%> away from me as a shepherd <S%H7473><s%>'s tent <S%H168><s%>: I have rolled <S%H7088><s%> up <S%H707><s%>, like a weaver, my life <S%H2416><s%>; he will cut me off <S%H1214><s%> from the loom <S%H1803><s%>: From day <S%H3117><s%> even to night <S%H3915><s%> wilt thou make an end of me <S%H7999><s%>.
